q: Dark times lie ahead of us and there will be a time when we must choose between what is easy and what is right.
h:
“Dark times lie ahead of us and there will be a time when we must choose between what is easy and what is right.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: Choose to be optimistic, it feels better.
h:
“Choose to be optimistic, it feels better.” —
Dalai Lama

q: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.
h:
“You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.
h:
“I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.” —
Carl Jung

q: Given the choice between the experience of pain and nothing, I would choose pain.
h:
“Given the choice between the experience of pain and nothing, I would choose pain.” —
William Faulkner

q: When you make a choice, you change the future.
h:
“When you make a choice, you change the future.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: When something comes from within, when it is a part of you, you have no choice but to live it, to express it.
h:
“When something comes from within, when it is a part of you, you have no choice but to live it, to express it.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: You cannot control the behavior of others, but you can always choose how you respond to it.
h:
“You cannot control the behavior of others, but you can always choose how you respond to it.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
h:
“Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.” —
Richard Bach

q: Anyone who dreams of an uncommon life eventually discovers there is no choice but to seek an uncommon approach to living it.
h:
“Anyone who dreams of an uncommon life eventually discovers there is no choice but to seek an uncommon approach to living it.” —
Gary Keller

q: When you get up in the morning, you have two choices - either to be happy or to be unhappy. Just choose to be happy.
h:
“When you get up in the morning, you have two choices - either to be happy or to be unhappy. Just choose to be happy.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: The content of your character is your choice. Day by day, what you choose, what you think and what you do is who you become.
h:
“The content of your character is your choice. Day by day, what you choose, what you think and what you do is who you become.” —
Heraclitus

q: When you have to make a choice and don't make it, that is in itself a choice.
h:
“When you have to make a choice and don't make it, that is in itself a choice.” —
William James

q: Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.
h:
“Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.” —
Jim Rohn

q: You're always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.
h:
“You're always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.” —
Richard Bach

q: Happiness is a choice and a skill and you can dedicate yourself to learning that skill and making that choice.
h:
“Happiness is a choice and a skill and you can dedicate yourself to learning that skill and making that choice.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: I'm an optimist by choice not by stupidity.
h:
“I'm an optimist by choice not by stupidity.” —
Yanni

q: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.
h:
“There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.” —
Denis Waitley

q: Patience expands your options. If you insist on immediate gratification, your choices are severely limited.
h:
“Patience expands your options. If you insist on immediate gratification, your choices are severely limited.” —
Ralph Marston

q: We have a choice everyday regarding the attitude we will embrace for that day.
h:
“We have a choice everyday regarding the attitude we will embrace for that day.” —
Charles Swindoll

q: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
h:
“It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: It is secondary whether we choose belief or defiance. What is precious is that we are always able to choose.
h:
“It is secondary whether we choose belief or defiance. What is precious is that we are always able to choose.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: FEAR has two meanings: 'Forget Everything And Run' or 'Face Everything And Rise.' The choice is yours.
h:
“FEAR has two meanings: 'Forget Everything And Run' or 'Face Everything And Rise.' The choice is yours.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
h:
“Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life. ” —
Confucius

q: Be careful the environment you choose for it will shape you; be careful the friends you choose for you will become like them.
h:
“Be careful the environment you choose for it will shape you; be careful the friends you choose for you will become like them.” —
W. Clement Stone

q: I am who I am today because of the choices I made yesterday.
h:
“I am who I am today because of the choices I made yesterday.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.
h:
“Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Change is inevitable but personal growth is a choice.
h:
“Change is inevitable but personal growth is a choice.” —
Bob Proctor

q: Once you choose hope, anything's possible.
h:
“Once you choose hope, anything's possible.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: A person is only by the thoughts that he chooses.
h:
“A person is only by the thoughts that he chooses.” —
James Allen

q: Happiness is a choice, not a result. Nothing will make you happy until you choose to be happy.
h:
“Happiness is a choice, not a result. Nothing will make you happy until you choose to be happy.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Life is a series of choices and all we can do is make them.
h:
“Life is a series of choices and all we can do is make them.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: It all depends on what you choose to believe.
h:
“It all depends on what you choose to believe.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Either you choose to stay in the shallow end of the pool or you go out into the ocean.
h:
“Either you choose to stay in the shallow end of the pool or you go out into the ocean.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: We can choose to look at whatever we want.  We can look at what's wrong in our life or we can look at what's right.
h:
“We can choose to look at whatever we want. We can look at what's wrong in our life or we can look at what's right.” —
Sonia Ricotti
